$ cat exp11m.cmd
#!/bin/bash

set -x  # echo commands

time ./crc8_formulate_problem.py -f 'exp11m.{0:04d}.txt' \
    -n 1000 \
    -t 4 \
    -c 00011111 \
    -i 00000000 \
    -d xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx \
       xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx

$ ./exp11m.cmd > exp11m.log 2>&1 &

$ ls exp11m.[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9].txt | wc -l
998

998 of 1000 attempts to find an embedding succeeded.

$ egrep 'max_chain_len' exp11m.[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9].txt | sort -k 3n | head -12
exp11m.0403.txt:max_chain_len = 5  <<--
exp11m.0457.txt:max_chain_len = 5
exp11m.0003.txt:max_chain_len = 6
exp11m.0014.txt:max_chain_len = 6
exp11m.0015.txt:max_chain_len = 6
exp11m.0018.txt:max_chain_len = 6
exp11m.0023.txt:max_chain_len = 6
exp11m.0044.txt:max_chain_len = 6
exp11m.0054.txt:max_chain_len = 6
exp11m.0065.txt:max_chain_len = 6
exp11m.0099.txt:max_chain_len = 6
exp11m.0102.txt:max_chain_len = 6

$ egrep 'avg_chain_len' exp11m.[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9].txt | sort -k 3n | head -12
exp11m.0187.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.666667
exp11m.0620.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.689394
exp11m.0403.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.691919  <<--
exp11m.0457.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.703283
exp11m.0624.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.703283
exp11m.0252.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.713384
exp11m.0736.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.713384
exp11m.0155.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.715909
exp11m.0312.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.717172
exp11m.0533.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.722222
exp11m.0835.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.722222
exp11m.0881.txt:avg_chain_len = 1.722222

Embedding 403 looks like a good candidate.  Its max chain len, 5, is as short
as any found.  Its avg chain len, 1.691919, is the third shortest, and not much
more than the very shortest.

$ ./crc8_run_on_qpu.py -f exp11m.0403.txt -s exp11m.0403.sampset.01.txt -n 2000

$ ./crc8_check_results.py -f exp11m.0403.txt -s exp11m.0403.sampset.01.txt > exp11m.0403.sampset.01.all.txt

$ cat exp11m.0403.sampset.01.all.txt | egrep valid
crc8 00011111 init 00000000 data 00001010 11010001 00110000 00011110 11011101 00111011 10100100 01111011 10011110 01100101 10011000 10100101 11001111 00111001 00111000 11101110 energy  211.0 computed-crc8 00011111 valid

$ cat exp11m.0403.sampset.01.all.txt | egrep valid | wc -l
11

$ cat exp11m.0403.sampset.01.all.txt | egrep valid | cut -c29-176
data 00001010 11010001 00110000 00011110 11011101 00111011 10100100 01111011 10011110 01100101 10011000 10100101 11001111 00111001 00111000 11101110

Out of 2000 samples, the Advantage_system1.1 QPU yielded 11 distinct valid
solutions.
